contentrichtext.text: {{italics title}}{{about|the news journal|the temperature at which a substance changes from liquid to solid|Melting point}} '''''Freezing Point''''' (Chinese: 冰点, Bīngdiǎn)<ref>Pinyin translated with [http://www.cozychinese.com/convert/ CozyChinese.COM]</ref> is a news journal in the [[People's Republic of China]] which has been the subject of controversy over its criticism of Communist Party officials and the sympathetic ear it lent to a Chinese historian who had criticized official history textbooks. A weekly supplement to ''[[China Youth Daily]]'', it was temporarily closed down by officials 24 January 2006, but was allowed to reopen in March that year,<!-- exact date?--> though without its former editor [[Li Datong]] and without [[Taiwan]]-based columnist [[Lung Yingtai]].<ref name=IoC>Isabel Hilton, "Surfing the Dragon", Index on Censorship, Volume 35, Number 4, 2006, p. 33–42. 42.</ref> The official reason for the January 2006 shutdown of ''Freezing Point'' was an article by history professor [[Yuan Weishi]] of [[Sun Yat-sen University]] (Zhongshan University). The article dissented from the official view of the [[Boxer Rebellion]].<ref name=IoC/> ==See also== * [[Media of the People's Republic of China]] * [[Censorship in the People's Republic of China]] ==Notes== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[http://chinadigitaltimes.net/tag/Freezing+Point Freezing Point on China Digital Times] *[http://nytimes.com/2006/02/16/international/asia/16cnd-china.html?hp&ex=1140152400&en=c3674ecb36c759c1&ei=5094&partner=homepage "Chinese Journal Closed by Censors Is to Reopen"], The New York Times, February 16, 2006. * "History Textbooks in China," by Yuan Weishi, and translations of articles on the closing of Bingdian, Feb. 2006 [http://www.zonaeuropa.com/20060126_1.htm] *[http://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2006/01/24/AR2006012401003.html Yuan Weishi, a reform-minded scholar... criticized Chinese textbooks for teaching an incomplete history of China's last imperial dynasty, the Qing, that fosters blind nationalism and closed-minded anti-foreign sentiment.] The New York Times 25 Jan 2008. <!-- *{{cite online journal | last = Long | first = Yingtai | authorlink = | coauthors = | year = | month = | title = '''REQUIRED''' | journal = | volume = | issue = | page = | pages = | article = | doi = | id = | url =http://www.opendemocracy.net/democracy-china/hu_jintao_3271.jsp | format = | accessdate = | accessdaymonth = | accessyear = }} --> {{PRChina-newspaper-stub}} {{Journalism-stub}} [[Category:Chinese-language newspapers (Simplified Chinese)]] [[Category:Newspapers published in the People's Republic of China]] [[Category:Publications with year of establishment missing]]
